item.text: These are the priests and Levites who returned with Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua: Seraiah, Jeremiah, Ezra,
<st data-num="0568" class="">Amariah</st>, <st data-num="04409" class="">Malluch</st>, <st data-num="02407" class="">Hattush</st>,
<st data-num="07935" class="">Shecaniah</st>, <st data-num="07348" class="">Rehum</st>, <st data-num="04822" class="">Meremoth</st>,
<st data-num="05714" class="">Iddo</st>, <st data-num="01599" class="">Ginnethon</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="029" class="">Abijah</st>,
<st data-num="04326" class="">Mijamin</st>, <st data-num="04573" class="">Moadiah</st>, <st data-num="01083" class="">Bilgah</st>,
<st data-num="08098" class="">Shemaiah</st>, <st data-num="03114" class="">Joiarib</st>, <st data-num="03048" class="">Jedaiah</st>,
Sallu, Amok, Hilkiah, and Jedaiah. These were the leaders of the priests and their colleagues in the days of Jeshua.
And the Levites: Jeshua, Binnui, Kadmiel, Sherebiah, Judah, and Mattaniah, who together with his colleagues was in charge of the songs of thanksgiving.
Bakbukiah and Unni, their colleagues, stood opposite them in the services.
Jeshua was the father of Joiakim, Joiakim was the father of Eliashib, Eliashib was the father of Joiada,
Joiada was the father of Jonathan, and Jonathan was the father of Jaddua.
In the days of Joiakim, these were the priests who were leaders of the families: of Seraiah, Meraiah; of Jeremiah, Hananiah;
of <st data-num="05830" class="">Ezra</st>, <st data-num="04918" class="">Meshullam</st>; of <st data-num="0568" class="">Amariah</st>, <st data-num="03076" class="">Jehohanan</st>;

of <st data-num="04409" class="">Malluch</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03129" class="">Jonathan</st>; of <st data-num="07645" class="">Shecaniah</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st>;
of <st data-num="02766" class="">Harim</st>, <st data-num="05733" class="">Adna</st>; of <st data-num="04812" class="">Meremoth</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02517" class="">Helkai</st>;
of <st data-num="05714" class="">Iddo</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02148" class="">Zechariah</st>; of <st data-num="01599" class="">Ginnethon</st>, <st data-num="04918" class="">Meshullam</st>;

of <st data-num="029" class="">Abijah</st>, <st data-num="02147" class="">Zicri</st>; of <st data-num="04509" class="">Miniamin</st> and<n id="1" /> of <st data-num="04153" class="">Moadiah</st>, <st data-num="06408" class="">Piltai</st>;
of <st data-num="01083" class="">Bilgah</st>, <st data-num="08051" class="">Shammua</st>; of <st data-num="08098" class="">Shemaiah</st>, <st data-num="03083" class="">Jehonathan</st>;
of <st data-num="03114" class="">Joiarib</st>, <st data-num="04982" class="">Mattenai</st>; of <st data-num="03048" class="">Jedaiah</st>, <st data-num="05813" class="">Uzzi</st>;
of <st data-num="05543" class="">Sallu</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07040" class="">Kallai</st>; of <st data-num="05987" class="">Amok</st>, <st data-num="05677" class="">Eber</st>;
of Hilkiah, Hashabiah; of Jedaiah, Nethanel.
As for the Levites, in the days of Eliashib, Joiada, Johanan, and Jaddua the heads of families were recorded, as were the priests during the reign of Darius the Persian.

The <st data-num="01121" class="">descendants</st> of <st data-num="03878" class="">Levi</st> were <st data-num="03789" class="">recorded</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="05612" class="">Book</st> of the <st data-num="01697 03117">Chronicles</st><n id="1" /> as <st data-num="07218" class="">heads</st> of <st data-num="01" class="">families</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">up to</st> the <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> of <st data-num="03110" class="">Johanan</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="0475" class="">Eliashib</st>.

And the leaders of the Levites were Hashabiah, Sherebiah, Jeshua son of Kadmiel, and their colleagues, who stood opposite them to offer praise and thanks, one contingent corresponding to the other, as specified by David the man of God.
Mattaniah, Bakbukiah, Obadiah, Meshullam, Talmon, and Akkub were gatekeepers who were guarding the storerooms at the gates.
These all served in the days of Joiakim son of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and in the days of Nehemiah the governor and of Ezra the priestly scribe.

At the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem, they sought out the Levites from all the places they lived to bring them to Jerusalem to celebrate the dedication joyfully with songs of thanksgiving and songs accompanied by cymbals, harps, and lyres.

The <st data-num="01121 07891">singers</st><n id="1" /> were also <st data-num="0622" class="">assembled</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="03603" class="">district</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">around</st> <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> and <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="02691" class="">settlements</st> of the <st data-num="05200" class="">Netophathites</st>

and from <st data-num="01004" class="">Beth</st> <st data-num="01537" class="">Gilgal</st> and from the <st data-num="07704" class="">fields</st> of <st data-num="01387" class="">Geba</st> and <st data-num="05820" class="">Azmaveth</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="07891" class="">singers</st> had <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st> <st data-num="02691" class="">settlements</st> for <st data-num="01992" class="">themselves</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">around</st> <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.
When the priests and Levites had purified themselves, they purified the people, the gates, and the wall.
I brought the leaders of Judah up on top of the wall, and I appointed two large choirs to give thanks. One was to proceed on the top of the wall southward toward the Dung Gate.

<st data-num="01980" class="">Going</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> them were <st data-num="01955" class="">Hoshaiah</st>, <st data-num="02677" class="">half</st> the <st data-num="08269" class="">leaders</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>,
<st data-num="05838" class="">Azariah</st>, <st data-num="05830" class="">Ezra</st>, <st data-num="04918" class="">Meshullam</st>,
<st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>, <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjamin</st>, <st data-num="08098" class="">Shemaiah</st>, <st data-num="03414" class="">Jeremiah</st>,

<st data-num="01121" class="">some</st> of the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st><n id="1" /> with <st data-num="02689" class="">trumpets</st>, <st data-num="02148" class="">Zechariah</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="03129" class="">Jonathan</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="08098" class="">Shemaiah</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="04983" class="">Mattaniah</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="04320" class="">Micaiah</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="02139" class="">Zaccur</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="0623" class="">Asaph</st>,

and his <st data-num="0251" class="">colleagues</st>—<st data-num="08098" class="">Shemaiah</st>, <st data-num="05832" class="">Azarel</st>, <st data-num="04450" class="">Milalai</st>, <st data-num="01562" class="">Gilalai</st>, <st data-num="04597" class="">Maai</st>, <st data-num="05417" class="">Nethanel</st>, <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>, and <st data-num="02607" class="">Hanani</st>—with <st data-num="07892" class="">musical</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">instruments</st> of<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> the <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> of <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>. (<st data-num="05830" class="">Ezra</st> the <st data-num="05608" class="">scribe</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">led</st> them.)<n id="2" />
They went over the Fountain Gate and continued directly up the steps of the City of David on the ascent to the wall. They passed the house of David and continued on to the Water Gate toward the east.
The second choir was proceeding in the opposite direction. I followed them, along with half the people, on top of the wall, past the Tower of the Ovens to the Broad Wall,
over the Ephraim Gate, the Jeshanah Gate, the Fish Gate, the Tower of Hananel, and the Tower of the Hundred, to the Sheep Gate. They stopped at the Gate of the Guard.
Then the two choirs that gave thanks took their stations in the temple of God. I did also, along with half the officials with me,

and the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>—<st data-num="0471" class="">Eliakim</st>, <st data-num="04641" class="">Maaseiah</st>, <st data-num="04509" class="">Miniamin</st>, <st data-num="04320" class="">Micaiah</st>, <st data-num="0454" class="">Elioenai</st>, <st data-num="02148" class="">Zechariah</st>, and <st data-num="02608" class="">Hananiah</st>, with their <st data-num="02689" class="">trumpets</st>—

and also <st data-num="04641" class="">Maaseiah</st>, <st data-num="08098" class="">Shemaiah</st>, <st data-num="0499" class="">Eleazar</st>, <st data-num="05813" class="">Uzzi</st>, <st data-num="03076" class="">Jehohanan</st>, <st data-num="04441" class="">Malkijah</st>, <st data-num="05867" class="">Elam</st>, and <st data-num="05829" class="">Ezer</st>. The <st data-num="07891" class="">choirs</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">sang loudly</st><n id="1" /> under the <st data-num="06496" class="">direction</st> of <st data-num="03156" class="">Jezrahiah</st>.
And on that day they offered great sacrifices and rejoiced, for God had given them great joy. The women and children also rejoiced. The rejoicing in Jerusalem could be heard from far away.

On that day men were appointed over the storerooms for the contributions, firstfruits, and tithes, to gather into them from the fields of the cities the portions prescribed by the law for the priests and the Levites, for the people of Judah took delight in the priests and Levites who were ministering.

They <st data-num="08104" class="">performed</st> the <st data-num="04931" class="">service</st> of their <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> and the <st data-num="04931" class="">service</st> of <st data-num="02893" class="">purification</st>, along with the <st data-num="07891" class="">singers</st> and <st data-num="07778" class="">gatekeepers</st>, according to the <st data-num="04687" class="">commandment</st> of <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> and<n id="1" /> his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st>.

<st data-num="03588" class="">For</st> <st data-num="06924" class="">long ago</st>, in the <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> of <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> and <st data-num="0623" class="">Asaph</st>, there had been <st data-num="07218" class="">directors</st><n id="1" /> for the <st data-num="07891" class="">singers</st> and for the <st data-num="07892" class="">songs</st> of <st data-num="08416" class="">praise</st> and <st data-num="03034" class="">thanks</st> to <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>.

So in the days of Zerubbabel and in the days of Nehemiah, all Israel was contributing the portions for the singers and gatekeepers, according to the daily need. They also set aside the portion for the Levites, and the Levites set aside the portion for the descendants of Aaron.
